subject: Spring is here, Perl 5.18.0 is out!

entries.text: Sebastian Riedel announces the release of Mojolicious 4.0, and with it a list of equaly delicious new features.
entries.title: Mojolicious 4.0 released: Perl real-time web framework

entries.text: David Golden owns the domain name 'vanillaperl.com', but don't really have a use for it. Have a good idea for it? Chime in, and the domain could be yours!
entries.title: Anyone want vanillaperl.com?

entries.text: Take a moment to read the changelog, fire up perlbrew and, if applicable, point and laugh at any poor schmuck close by still stuck on 5.6.
entries.title: Perl 5.18 is out!
Strawberry Perl 5.18.0.1 released
entries.text: You hardly had time to download the source code of Perl 5.18.0, KMX already created the Strawberry Perl package for Windows!
Perl and Windows? Is it long-term skills? How to carve a niche for yourself? A new Perl user has questions, brian d foy answers them, Dear Abby-style.
entries.title: Advice to a new Perl user

entries.text: A new version of Test::Class::Moose is out. Ovid walks us through the new, cleanier class-to-test-file interface it provides.
entries.title: Cleaning up the Test::Class::Moose base class

entries.text: You're probably aware of the token '__PACKAGE__'. But do you know you can also access the current file, and line of code? What about the embedded data stream?
entries.title: Perl tokens you should know

entries.text: Yanick announces the appearance of a new fast web escaping module on the scene.
entries.title: Escape::Houdini and Related Tales of Prestidigitation

entries.text: Mike B points out that Net::SSLGlue now support POP3 with TLS security.
entries.title: POP3 with TLS in Perl

entries.text: Yanick touts a new release of GitStore, which provides a nice interface to MooseX::Storage, and thus makes storing Moose objects into a Git repository a breeze.
entries.title: New And Improved: GitStore Meets MooseX::Storage

entries.text: How easy is it to install psgi-based applications using Chef? Pretty darn easy, according to melezhik's examples.
entries.title: psgi applications easy install with chef

entries.text: Gabor Szabo is on an interview roll. This time, it's genehack's turn.
entries.title: Interview with John SJ Anderson (aka genehack)

entries.text: Grasping the opportunity for serendipisism, Joel Berger has updated his Mojolicious introduction slide-deck for Mojolicious 4.0.
entries.title: My "Mojolicious Introduction" now updated for 4.0

entries.text: Jonathan Worthington keeps us up-to-date with what is happening in the world of Rakudo.
entries.title: Rakudo on JVM progress update, and some questions answered

entries.text: The Haskell community prides itself in being able to implement the quicksort algorithm in a succint yet elegant way. Dominic Humphries shows that Perl ain't too shabby for it either.
entries.title: Quicksort golf

entries.text: Rohan Almeida tackles this classic coding exercise, and by the same token provides us with a nifty example of Perl 6 programming.
entries.title: Solving the Balanced Brackets task using Perl 6 - Part 1
Grant Application: Maintaining Perl 5
entries.text: This time by Tony Cook

entries.title: Strings in Perl: quoted, interpolated and escaped
entries.text: Do you know how what is the difference between single-quote and double-quote in Perl? Do you know how to use q and qq?

entries.title: Using a queue in Perl
entries.text: Do you know what FIFO is, and how to implement one in Perl?
May 25-26, 2013, Warsaw, Poland
entries.title: Polish Perl Workshop 2013

entries.text: June 3-5, 2013, Austin, Texas, USA
entries.title: YAPC::NA 2013
French Perl Workshop 2013
entries.text: June 14-15, 2013, Nancy, France
August 12-14, 2013, Kiev, Ukraine
entries.title: YAPC::EU 2013

chapters.title: Events
chapters.header: I usually list the next 3-4 events here. The list of all the events can be found on the web site. If your Perl event is not listed there, please let me know.
